pros: Friendly environment and good training

job_title: Sheltered Scheme Manager in Newcastle upon Tyne, England
pros: Lovely colleagues in immediate team and fab line manager. Pleasure to work with the residents Bank Holidays off work Lovely colleagues who we work with in the lettings team . Good surveyors and contractors Lovely to be in the heart of the community as a,schemecmanager
cons: Poor letting standards causing embarrassment for Scheme Managers who work so hard to create lovely communities. Poor values, poor attitude towards scheme managers from Anchor as an organisation. Poor training for Scheme Managers It systems not fit for purpose. Always some half thought through Scheme going on to reorganise which puts jobs at risk Poor wages for the massive responsibility Scheme managers have. People who work in head office often have no idea what the scheme managers role actually is. Top heavy, too many layers trying to shape the future but fail to listen to the people who really matter. Ridiculous scheme where scheme managers are telephoned outwith their working hours to come in to deal with emergencies and incidents. Rigid and non person centered rules around bereavement leave. All take and absolutely no give. Hard work not recognised . Great managers not celebrated, doesn't matter if you do the job well or badly its all the same to anchor. Poor structures to support managers to do the very demanding job they do

pros: Quite good rates of pay
cons: Very high turnover of staff

job_title: HR-Admin in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England

cons: Low salaries, not much career progression.

pros: Good company to work for

job_title: Leadership and Talent Manager in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros:
The people who work at Anchor are genuinely welcoming and all working to a clear end purpose. 

I’ve worked in many organisations where they say the customer is at the heart of what they do but it clearly isn’t. At Anchor it absolutely it.

 There is so much love and respect for those who live with us, As a member of a central support function this results in feeling more connected with a clearer purpose. 

On a more functional level, hybrid and home working in most head office roles is embraced and supported
cons: Nothing in life is perfect and there is always work being carried out to improve what we do. Don’t expect up to date data insight and tech - but it’s on its way soon.

pros: I have worked for Anchor for 18 months and enjoy every day. My estate is 46 properties, so can be very busy. We do a good job, because the heart of the organisation is steered around excellent customer service, being responsive, adapting to change and always trying to support and improve the lives of our residents. For staff, there is lots of additional support and benefits that we can tap into. Personally, I genuinely feel appreciated. We have an amazing on call team, that supports managers out of hours.
cons: We have some very elderly, frail residents living on our estates and the lack of support from GP's and Social Services can be a very difficult part of this role at times.

pros: Residents are the best thing about the care home
cons: bullying in the workplace. Managers don't care. Get treat like rubbish and no training

job_title: Food and Beverage Assistant in Bishopstoke, England
pros: Ok place to work. A bit tense
cons: higher management was not in touch with staff.

job_title: Manager in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: Always been treated well and work with a fabulous team. Anchor are invested in their employees and always want them to do their best. Great work/life balance and plenty of opportunities for training/upskilling yourself.
cons: No cons to working at Anchor

job_title: Housing Scheme Manager in Poole, England
pros: Lone working and management of your own schedule
cons: Very stressful with all the complaints and the companies systems were awful

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: From my initial application to now being with the business 8 weeks, its been a great experience from the outset. I've never had this experience in other places i've worked.
cons: I don't have any cons to share

job_title: Care Assistant in Otley, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: Free meals, free PPE, some great carers, lovely residents.
cons: No back up from management. No confidentiality. Management only listen to those they choose to. Don’t listen to anyone else. Don’t take advice well. Favour those who speak the loudest. Very little progression. They don’t hire internally unless brown nose, doesn’t matter if you are actually good at your job or not. Never any positive comments. Very high turnover of staff!

pros: Pay I guess, the only thing.
cons:
Admins basically need to be the bed rag of everyone, every time you want to ask for annual leave is a continuous bargain, NO BREAKS DURING CHRISTMAS, The office is open and in the front and I am forced to be the punching ball of everyone that had a bad day, if they see you breathing a second they will bother you dumping more tasks on you ON PURPOSE, they promised me a career when Care Home Admins DON'T HAVE ONE, and whenever I spoke out about how stressed I am about it I get ALWAYS REBUKED AND IGNORED. 
Oh and let's not forget, they will NEVER HIRE A RECEPTIONIST TO EASE OUT TASKS NOT EVEN UNDER TORTURE BECAUSE YOU WILL BE THE FIRST POINT OF CONTACT AND FIRST IDIOT AT THE FRONT. 
I wanted to work in a normal office, not in a care home. This job gave me anxiety, stress and made me absolutely hate social care. 
The hell with this.

job_title: Marketing Manager in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros:
Anchor is an incredible supportive company with fantastic learning and development opportunities. In just 12 months I progressed from an Executive to a Manager and have training lined up to ensure I am confident and have all the skills I need to be a great leader. 

There's a huge range of benefits on offer from a great pension scheme to health and wellbeing support. There's even high street discounts on your food shops, phones and gym memberships. 

The culture among the team is very open and collaborative where all feedback is encouraged and listened to. My manager is incredibly supportive and encouraging as well.
cons: I haven't experienced any cons of working here - occasionally there's busy periods like with any job but I always feel supported by my colleagues and manager.

job_title: Care Assistant in Thames Ditton, England
pros: I love working at anchor because the team are incredible, I love working with every single one of them and there’s a real community spirit where I am. Spending time with the residents and making them smile is a huge highlight of this job.
cons: Only getting up early, other than that not many cons.

review_title: Great place to work with lots of flexibility

pros:
Decent salary and opportunities for progression
Access to lots of training and development
Flexible hybrid working which gives me a great work life balance

cons: You can apply for a blue light card when working here but this isn't advertised as one of the company benefits for some reason

pros: Staff Nice and residents nice
cons: Pay low and long hours

pros: Good work life balance and decent contract conditions.

pros:
Anchor has many option for career progression and development. At Anchor staffs are encouraged to complete qualification which are relevant to their job role and create ways for career opportunities. 

Anchor has a lots of benefits to be used on high streets and online shopping.
cons: The uniforms are made mostly in big sizes and for average heights and tall individuals. Am petite and a size 4-6. It would be nice to have uniforms which fits me.

pros: None, none, none, none, none
cons: Staff are constantly overworked, they take residents that aren’t appropriate for the facility because it’s a ‘body’ to them and that means more money. review_title: Poor systems, and unwilling to invest.
pros: Great people. I loved my team.
cons:
Systems were poor, the IT systems and support were the worst I've ever encountered. 
It wouldn't take much time or effort, and barely any money to update the systems and the way of working to enable people to get their jobs done effectively, instead time and again we found ourselves working until 10pm, or at weekends to get the job done because of poor systems and siloed information from above. Yes, we were always told to take the time back but we never got the chance to do it because there was always another deadline on account of everything taking five times longer than it should. Exhausting and demoralising.

review_title: Make their best, most committed people redundant then make life difficult
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: Anchor has a great ethos, positive working environment, some supportive managers in the organization, put the customer first
cons:
Make absurd recruitment decisions for senior management roles, allow said managers to discriminate against women for having children, allow them to make people redundant for having children... oh but then getting rid of said manager shortly after instead of reversing or halting redundancy decision.

Pension is good while you're in it, but when you leave you're lucky if you get any information about your pension (5 months of chasing), and when you ask them to send you your P60 they tell you to use their unfriendly HR self-service system which you have no access to because you don't work there. Making a simple request difficult for no apparent reason.

review_title: Good learning experience, a stepping stone that is all.  Culture is however changing
pros: Great learning and development opportunities to gain experience in social housing. Regardless what level you are on, ( front line to senior management) working here plus hard work will gain you that experience you need to take you to the next level, which will be vital when applying for your next job. Hence why so many top staff leave after a couple of years.  You can discover your potential here, test your strengths.
cons: Very little room for progression unless you are chums with senior management. I have witnessed this on so many occasion and many restructuring was a result of it. Too many bright ideas, reactive, easily influenced under pressure.  Processes and systems are slow and needs stream lining.

review_title: A great company to work for...but still room for improvement
job_title: Team Leader in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Anchor are an excellent company to work for and do respect their employees and customers. Always looking to get value for money for customers. Training of staff is second to none
cons: The problem with Anchor is that they expect too much from their staff  there is not enough understanding by head office on what the estate managers are expected to do in the time available.

job_title: Scheme Cleaner in Clacton-on-Sea, Essex, East of England, England
pros: my manager trusts me to get on with the job always there helping me and dealing with each and every individual tenant she also visits tenants in flats there is a good atmosphere i cant put on here the amount of dedication she puts into working for anchor it would fill the whole page. she has come into work sick  and still helps all of us she is very discreet when i need to speak to her on a professional or personal matter
cons: tenants like to have a conversation with me during works time i have send them to manager i am caring and compassionate its just the way i am we need more like her no two managers are alike  if a job isnt on my list she will ask me are you ok doing this my reply is yes im provided with cleaning products and dust masks

pros: I loved my years working at Anchor and met some fantastic people and friends along the way that i still now keep in touch with.. Anchor were not only very supportive at developing my career path with various training courses but also were very supportive of my colleagues, tenants and customers over the years I only moved on to further my career development as there is a huge step upwards between being a Scheme Manager to District Manager level.
cons: Not any i can think of I enjoyed my whole time working for Anchor and would run back in a heartbeat if there were an inbetween level of roles.

review_title: Really poor management, recruitment procedure and communications
pros: I worked in the head office. Nice people to work with( in the head office). You are given lot of trust and freedom to do your job.
cons: Poor control on how the care home are run. Some care home manager are dishonest. The people promoted to manager position don't have much experience and knowledge when in fact they do have great people with great experience working there. For a charity I found that the values and the culture of the company was really poor.

job_title: Activity Coordinator in Otley, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: always up to date training going on, you can progress if you wish to do so. bonus at certain years you have been there, good policies, nice to work for. always striving to make it better and progress and move forward
cons: there is no sick pay, polyester uniforms are constricting and you cant breathe in them, its always too warm and with staff always on the go you get sweaty and these uniforms make you worse , no air con, sometimes understaffed and having to get agency .

job_title: Care Assistant in East Molesey, England
pros: Great support from HR with my enquiry, really enjoyed the working ways, shift times and pattern. Worked with great collegues and done everything by the cqc codes of practice. I also got more pay than most care homes due to my nvq 2 I received £8 per hour where other companies still give me minimum wage :(
cons: My first month's pay was delayed for another month; however this was my fault as I didn't submit my application form properly. My manager subed me for that month and hr paif me the following month for two months pay (minus the sub)

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: The team I worked in. Everyone was very supportive of each other. Generally good team working across the business. There are very dedicated staff across the Care Homes and Schemes.
cons: The constant restructures. I wasn't made redundant but many of my colleagues were, and it became a very depressing place to be, across the support services function.

pros: Every shift is different the job is never boring, any ideas are welcomed, customers smile when they see you come in and appreciate what we do for them.
cons: As a relief I quite often don't get the time to do what is required of me especially if it is on a weekday answering calls/problems etc can take longer than expected.

review_title: Does not live the values - not accountable, not respectful,  not courageous and definitely not honest
job_title: Manager in Swindon, Gloucestershire, South West England, England
pros: Salary quite reasonable, generally a good bunch of people in the non-senior positions
cons: Expect no autonomy.  You will be kept in the dark, just like the mushroom joke.  They hire you for skills and then don't trust you to use them.  Mediocre management who wouldn't last a day in a commercial environment.  No prospects and the merger causing a lot of people to leave, disillusioned.

pros: Luxury environment to work in, some amazing colleagues. Lovely customers.
cons: Not well paid. Very poor leadership and management. Managers not willing to take accountability for their own actions or lead by example. No job security, worked too hard always too busy making it impossible to provide the level of care you would like to provide. Never enough staff on shift. Have to work weekends. Didn't feel valued, didn't feel appreciated. Didn't have any trust or faith in the care manager, certainly didn't feel that they were competent at all.

job_title: Care Assistant in East Grinstead, England
pros: the job is very rewarding and its amazing the kinds of people you meet.
cons: its a poorly paid position with low staffing, you'll be very tired. our admin is useless and messes up pay more than anywhere else ive ever been.

pros: None really - there is nothing I can say about this company to recommend them to anyone.
cons: This company has the worst management I have ever had the displeasure of working with. They have no idea as to how to talk to their staff and treat them with respect. At the home I worked in the staff were actually reporting back to management about their colleagues mostly imaginary misdemeanours, which resulted in at atmosphere of distrust.

job_title: Recruiter in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: Nice environment to work in - clean tidy and well maintained. Lots of nice people worked here when I did.
cons: Changed my role after a few months of working here. Lots of travel involved. Systems were still in development stages and not fully working.

job_title: Estate/Team Manager in Abbots Langley, England
pros: Every day is different, great support from local colleagues and line manager, very satisfying to work with older people and see and hear their satisfaction.
cons: Poor awareness of front line problems by support staff, staff cuts due to economic reasons creating greater workloads for "coal face workers"

pros: Good training, friendly and helpful staff, great out of hours service, good working conditions, good hours, quality service, good holidays.
cons: Some of the systems can be a bit complicated, depending on role you are sometimes a jack of all trades. Other than that there aren't anymore cons.

pros: Brilliant staff and customer
cons: HR are heartless and don’t have a care in the world  for single parent with financial difficulties due to going to another job   Overpaid for holidays just an excuse to get there money back

pros: Working for/with Anchor means progressing your carer. the opportunities ti develop your skills are brilliant and with schemes like get connected and cycle to work what more could you ask for?
cons: sometimes you get so consumed in your work that you end up taking it home.

pros: The only pro I can think if is that you get paid every month
cons: Management are unsupportive in every way - if you have a grievance you are simply told to stop being negative and move on... Management cover each other's backs when one of them is in the wrong and from personal experience they regularly twist the truth and are devious and under handed when they are challenged

pros: Working as a Care Assistant at Prior Bank in Sheffield was wonderful. I had the opportunity to look after some of the most vulnerable service users.
cons: There is nothing negative I can think about

job_title: Training Team Leader in Guildford, England

cons: Huge company, may get lost in crowd if not loud enough ;)

job_title: HOC Customer Service Advisor in Chippenham, South West England, England
pros: Good in-house system and a feel good job as you are there to help the elderly
